title: PSA On Internet Connection
body:
So from time to time we all experience a bad connection, we hope it wont effect our gameplay, either through us disconnecting or a team mate.

For years I've been having trouble with my connection, thankfully it hasn't majorly effected my experience that much, but occasionally it does.
For years my family has been struggling to get Telstra to listen to us over the issues.
Cracking sounds on the landline.
Constant drop outs to the internet.
Slower speeds than we should be getting.
Phone calls dropping the internet connection even if they are unanswered.
Today the Telstra representative finally asked that one question, finally the question that opens the door to help, on a piece of the puzzle that has gone overlooked all this time.

"What shape is your wall connection, square or rectangle?"
"Square."
"Oh... okay..."
"We still have the original phone that came with the installation."
"Wow! ... that might not support the connections it's been forced to deal with."

Our Telecom lines and wall socket are at minimum 30 years old.
They have not had any maintenance by Telstra or Optus.
They should have been updated and replaced when we switched from Dial-Up to ADSL all those years ago. (Currently on ADSL2)

So we are getting technicians sent once again, and Telstra will update our wiring at their own expense.

When was the last time your wiring was checked?
Is it too out of date?
Your wall socket, is it square or rectangular?

replies.body: even after the upgrade it its still going to be shit internet and telstra are the worst mob for it https://www.reddit.com/r/explainlikeimfive/comments/40m0t8/eli5why_is_australian_internet_so_bad_and_why_is/ follow the link to learn a bit about why we prob have the worst internet of any first world country

In the end it doesn't matter, I live on the outskirts of a small country town.
There is literally no option other than Telstra and Optus as Telstra own the lines to our house and no other company will rent the lines.

Our only hope is to go with Satelite NBN if we want another company.
Honestly, you would think that would be one of the first things they would ask.
